company_context: Jenkins Jenkins Build great things at any scale The leading open source automation server, Jenkins provides hundreds of plugins to support building, deploying and automating any project. Download Documentation Redesigned Jenkins header and UI Jenkins' UI has been redesigned and updated for a more modern look and feel. Read more about the background and various changes in Jan Faracik's blog post. Read here Jenkins 2025 Community Awards The Jenkins 2025 Community Awards winners have been announced! Congratulations to all the winners and thank you for all of your contributions. Thanks to the community for voting and making this possible. Read more about the awards and winners in our blog. Jenkins wins DevOps Dozen award Jenkins has been awarded the "Most innovative DevOps Open Source project" distinction by DevOps Dozen. More info Announcing the new Jenkins Bug Bounty Program! The European Commission (EC OSPO) has partnered with YesWeHack to launch bug bounty programs for several open source projects, including the new Jenkins Bug Bounty Program! More info Meet the driving forces behind Jenkins as we showcase the top contributors shaping the future of continuous integration and delivery. More info Jenkins Stories! We are looking for experiences of Jenkins users from around the world showcasing how they are building, deploying, and automating great software with Jenkins. Check out their user stories and share yours More info Participate and Contribute! Jenkins is a community-driven project. We invite everyone to join us and move it forward. Any contribution matters: code, documentation, localization, blog posts, artwork, meetups, and anything else. If you have five minutes or a few hours, you can help! More info Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery As an extensible automation server, Jenkins can be used as a simple CI server or turned into the continuous delivery hub for any project. Easy installation Jenkins is a self-contained Java-based program, ready to run out-of-the-box, with packages for Windows, Linux, macOS and other Unix-like operating systems. Easy configuration Jenkins can be easily set up and configured via its web interface, which includes on-the-fly error checks and built-in help. Plugins With hundreds of plugins in the Update Center, Jenkins integrates with practically every tool in the continuous integration and continuous delivery toolchain. Extensible Jenkins can be extended via its plugin architecture, providing nearly infinite possibilities for what Jenkins can do. Distributed Jenkins can easily distribute work across multiple machines, helping drive builds, tests and deployments across multiple platforms faster. Recent posts Impressions from Jenkins Stand at FOSDEM Brussels Two Days Behind the Jenkins Booth at FOSDEM 2026 FOSDEM is always a blur. Two days, hundreds of conversations, one booth, and just enough coffee and beer to get through the weekend. This year at FOSDEM 2026, I had the privilege of standing behind th

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi [CTO's Name], this is [SDR's Name] from DeepData AI. I know you're likely busy, but I'm reaching out because we work with a lot of companies that leverage Jenkins for their CI/CD pipelines, and we've found a significant opportunity to improve their data processing efficiency. Is now a bad time?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: [CTO's Name]: DeepData AI? Never heard of you. And no, now isn't a great time. We're heads-down on a major release. What is it you do?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand. We help organizations like yours streamline and accelerate their data processing, particularly the kind of data generated by complex build and deployment processes. Given Jenkins' ubiquity, we often see bottlenecks in how that data is analyzed for insights into development velocity and potential issues. Our platform uses AI to process this data significantly faster and uncover patterns traditional methods miss.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: [CTO's Name]: "AI for data processing." That's a pretty broad claim. We're using Jenkins extensively, yes, but we already have our own internal analytics tools and a team dedicated to interpreting that data. Frankly, I don't see what a third-party solution could offer that we can't already handle.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I appreciate that. Many of our clients felt the same initially. The key difference with DeepData AI is the *depth* and *speed* of analysis. For instance, are you currently able to automatically identify the root cause of flaky tests across your entire Jenkins history, or predict potential deployment failures before they happen based on historical build metrics? We've seen companies reduce their data processing time by up to 70% and uncover critical issues that were previously invisible.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: [CTO's Name]: Look, I appreciate the enthusiasm, but that sounds like a significant integration effort and a substantial cost. We're not actively looking for new tools right now, and honestly, I'm skeptical about the ROI on something like this without seeing concrete proof. We have a solid system in place and our priorities are elsewhere.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand your hesitation regarding integration and cost. We've designed DeepData AI to integrate seamlessly with Jenkins via existing plugins, minimizing disruption and usually taking less than a day to get up and running. We also offer flexible pricing models tailored to your data volume. To address your skepticism, I'd love to show you a brief, 15-minute demo specifically focused on how we could analyze your Jenkins data. We could even run a sample analysis on a subset of your anonymized build logs to demonstrate the insights we can uncover. How about we schedule that for Tuesday morning?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: [CTO's Name]: No, thank you. We're happy with our current setup and have no budget allocated for this type of solution. Please don't call again.

analysis.raw:
Score: 2
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Timing
Feedback: The seller should have asked more qualifying questions early on to determine if the timing was right or if the CTO had a real need for their solution before diving into a product pitch. Sentiment: Negative

parsed.feedback: The seller should have asked more qualifying questions early on to determine if the timing was right or if the CTO had a real need for their solution before diving into a product pitch. Sentiment: Negative
